message.content:
Below is one workable “takeoff” for re‐creating the little rocket exactly as shown.  I will break it down into three parts:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1)  ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET STRUCTURE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Block Count: 9  
  – Base Layer (5 blocks):  
     1. Orange triangular wedge (left)  
     2. Yellow cube (left center)  
     3. Red ring block (center)  
     4. Yellow cube (right center)  
     5. Orange triangular wedge (right)  
  – Second Layer (2 blocks):  
     6. Green cube (left)  
     7. Blue cube (right)  
  – Top Layer (2 blocks):  
     8. Orange triangular wedge (left)  
     9. Orange triangular wedge (right)  

• Layering & Adjacencies:
  – On the bottom row, the ring is flanked by two yellow cubes, with an orange wedge at each outer edge.  
  – Above those yellow cubes/ring sit two single‐color cubes (green on the left, blue on the right).  
  – Two more orange wedges meet at the apex to form the triangular “roof.”  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2)  SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Below is which dictionary index matches each piece (no rotations allowed):

1. Orange wedge (base left) → Index 13  
2. Yellow cube (base left center) → Index 9  
3. Red ring (center) → Index 5  
4. Yellow cube (base right center) → Index 9 (use a second copy)  
5. Orange wedge (base right) → Index 16  
6. Green cube (second layer left) → Index 7  
7. Blue cube (second layer right) → Index 6  
8. Orange wedge (top left) → Index 14  
9. Orange wedge (top right) → Index 15  

Note that we use each wedge index exactly as shown (13, 14, 15, 16) so that their slopes match the target photo without rotation.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3)  STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

{
  Step1: Move block with index 13
  Step2: Move block with index 9
  Step3: Move block with index 5
  Step4: Move block with index 9
  Step5: Move block with index 16
  Step6: Move block with index 7
  Step7: Move block with index 6
  Step8: Move block with index 14
  Step9: Move block with index 15
}

Following these nine steps will reproduce the same “rocket” structure shown in the target image.
